content.description: Stand start with a left hand microedge on the face and a right hand jug on the arete. From there, bump up through a pair of left hand sloping bumps, gain the jug, match, bring the feet over left to the platform, and finish up the featured slab.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is good, but there are a few rocks that require padding.
content.location: It climbs the southeast arete of Biggie.

content.description: Squat start matched on the arete (proper sit is possible as well but is fairly reachy, adds a hand flip). From there, bump the right hand up the arete to a pinch, gain a left hand jug, and continue up the generous bumps to the slab and an easy finish.
content.protection: This felt nice having three pads. The landing is good, but there are some rocks near the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the south facing arete/dihedral of the Biggie Boulder.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull and a deeply incut, right hand edge. From there, pull up to a good, horizontal edge below the lip, then follow it to the lip, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The landing has a few rocks, but it pads up nicely.
content.location: It climbs the short, featured east face of Biggie.
